snippet: While it is not uncommon for a presidential candidate to know his opponent’s No. 2 better, the history between President Obama and Paul Ryan sets up an especially intriguing showdown.
abstract: Pres Barack Obama and Rep Paul D Ryan, both leading antagonists in an increasingly rancorous debate over the size and scope of government, have been sparring with each other since Obama was elected in 2008; their history should make for an especially intriguing showdown.
lead_paragraph: While it is not uncommon for a presidential candidate to know his opponent’s No. 2 better, the history between President Obama and Paul Ryan sets up an especially intriguing showdown.

headline.seo: Obama and Ryan, From Potential Partners to Rivals
headline.main: For Ryan and Obama, More Than the Usual Rivalry
headline.print_headline: With a History of Sparring, Obama and Ryan Are Ready for a Showdown
